_source.text: 1 Kings 21:1-4 NKJV 1 And it came to pass after these things that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard which was in Jezreel, next to the palace of Ahab king of Samaria. 2 So Ahab spoke to Naboth, saying, "Give me your vineyard, that I may have it for a vegetable garden, because it is near, next to my house; and for it I will give you a vineyard better than it.

text: 1 Kings 21:1-4 NKJV 1 And it came to pass after these things that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard which was in Jezreel, **next** to the palace of Ahab king of Samaria. 2 So Ahab spoke to Naboth, saying, "Give me your vineyard, that I may have it for a vegetable garden, **because** it is near, **next** to my **house**; and for it I will give you a vineyard **better** **than** it.

_source.text: 2  So Ahab spoke to Naboth, saying, "Give me your vineyard, that I may have it for a vegetable garden, because it is near, next to my house; and for it I will give you a vineyard better than it.

text: 2  So Ahab spoke to Naboth, saying, "Give me your vineyard, that I may have it for a vegetable garden, **because** it is near, **next** to my **house**; and for it I will give you a vineyard **better** **than** it.

_source.text: 12.            Nathan and Bathsheba - I Kings 1: 1-27 - This story is better than an episode of "House of Cards" - and in some ways it's reminiscent of the way Naomi and Ruth plotted together - while we've already talked about David, it's important to note how he resolves the situation with what amounts to a giant political rally - all of this comes together to make Solomon the next King of Israel.

text: 12.            Nathan and Bathsheba - I Kings 1: 1-27 - This story **is** **better** **than** an episode of
"**House** of Cards" - and in some ways it's reminiscent of the way Naomi and Ruth plotted together - while
amounts to a giant political rally - all of this comes together to make Solomon the **next** King of Israel.

_source.text: Actually, Adelson is worse than either: his serious proposal for dealing with Iran is to drop a "demonstration" nuclear bomb in their desert, then follow it up with "the next one in the middle of Tehran" if they refuse to surrender.

text: Actually, Adelson **is** **worse** **than** either: his serious proposal for dealing with Iran is to drop a
"demonstration" nuclear bomb in their desert, then follow it up with "the **next** one in **the** **middle** of Tehran" if they refuse to surrender.
